Package fi.abo.kogni.soile2.projecthandling.projectElements.impl

Class ElementManager<T extends ElementBase>

java.lang.Object
fi.abo.kogni.soile2.projecthandling.projectElements.impl.ElementManager<T>
Type Parameters:
T - The class of the Element managed by this manager needs to implement ElementBase
public class ElementManager<T extends ElementBase> extends Object
The element Manager handles DB elements and their link to the git Repositories. TODO: We need to allow proper tagging. By default, the list of versions should only return tagged versions (i.e. versions with a tag), and only if actual versions are requested those should be returned with a date stamp. There should be two different updates: Tagged updates and Automatic updates.
Author:
Thomas Pfau

    • getGitIDForUUID

      public String getGitIDForUUID(String UUID)
      Get the ID of the repository for this type of Element.
      Parameters:
      UUID - the UUID of the element
      Returns:
      the Supplemented ID of the element representing the repository ID

    • cleanUp

      public void cleanUp()
      Clean up any caches used by this manager. This is mainly data from the git Repository.

    • createElement

      public io.vertx.core.Future<T> createElement(String name, String type, String languageversion)
      Create a new element. This future can fail with an ElementNameExistException with id = name, which indicates that an element with this name already exists.
      Parameters:
      name - name of the new element
      type - the code type (only applicable for Tasks)
      languageversion - the version of the language (only aplicable to tasks) TODO: Refactor so that this is a second argument "Properties" instead of specific arguments for tasks.
      Returns:
      A Future of an object of the Type managed by this manager

    • createElement

      public io.vertx.core.Future<T> createElement(String name)
      Create a new element. This future can fail with an ElementNameExistException with id = name, which indicates that an element with this name already exists.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the element
      Returns:
      A Future of an object of the Type managed by this manager

    • createOrLoadElement

      public io.vertx.core.Future<T> createOrLoadElement(String name, String type, String version)
      Load or Create an element. This should not normally be called but might be necessary for some tests.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the element to load
      type - the code type of the element (Tasks only)
      version - the version of the code type, i.e. laguage (Tasks only) TODO: REFACTOR to not use version and type but instead a properties object.
      Returns:
      A Future of an object of the Type managed by this manager

    • createOrLoadElement

      public io.vertx.core.Future<T> createOrLoadElement(String name)
      Create or load an Element This future can fail with an ElementNameExistException with id = name, which indicates that an element with this name already exists.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the element
      Returns:
      A Future of an object of the Type managed by this manager

    • getGitJson

      public io.vertx.core.Future<io.vertx.core.json.JsonObject> getGitJson(String elementID, String elementVersion)
      Get the Git Json for the given element at the given ID. This is the Git Object of the element.
      Parameters:
      elementID - the elementID
      elementVersion - the version to retrieve
      Returns:
      A Future of the JsonObject that was stored in git.

    • getElement

      public io.vertx.core.Future<T> getElement(String elementID)
      Get the Element stored in the Database with the given ID.
      Parameters:
      elementID - the ID of the element.
      Returns:
      a Future of the element managed by this Manager.

    • updateElement

      public io.vertx.core.Future<String> updateElement(APIElement<T> newData)
      Update the given element in the database and on git using the Data from the provided API element
      Parameters:
      newData - the data with which to update the element
      Returns:
      A Future of the new version of the element

    • updateElement

      public io.vertx.core.Future<String> updateElement(APIElement<T> newData, String tag)
      Update the given element in the database and on git using the Data from the provided API element
      Parameters:
      newData - the new data for the element
      tag - the tag to give the new version
      Returns:
      A Future of the new version of the element

    • deleteElement

      public io.vertx.core.Future<Boolean> deleteElement(APIElement<T> deletionData)
      Delete the given element. This does NOT actually delete the element, but makes it invisible, so it can still be used but it can no longer be modified or updated. Elements that contain it will still be valid, but the element can no longer be updated.
      Parameters:
      deletionData - An API element indicating what should be deleted
      Returns:
      A Future that succeeds if the element was deleted

    • deleteElement

      public io.vertx.core.Future<Boolean> deleteElement(String UUID)
      Delete the given element. This does NOT actually delete the element, but makes it invisible, so it can still be used but it can no longer be modified or updated. Elements that contain it will still be valid, but the element can no longer be updated.
      Parameters:
      UUID - the UUID of the element to delete
      Returns:
      A Future that succeeds if the element was deleted

    • removeElementAndCleanUpGit

      public io.vertx.core.Future<Boolean> removeElementAndCleanUpGit(String UUID)
      Finally remove the given Element. There will be a last check,
      Parameters:
      UUID - the uuid of the element to remove
      Returns:
      A Future that succeeds if the element was deleted

    • getElementList

      public io.vertx.core.Future<io.vertx.core.json.JsonArray> getElementList(boolean full)
      Get the List of all elements of the specified type. Returns a list of the elements handled by this Manager
      Parameters:
      full - whether to obtain all (including invisible) elements (access was checked before).
      Returns:
      A Future that contains a list of all elements

    • getTagForElementVersion

      public io.vertx.core.Future<String> getTagForElementVersion(String id, String version)
      Get the Tag of a specific version of an element, if it exists (null otherwise).
      Parameters:
      id - The id of the element in question
      version - The version of the element
      Returns:
      A Future of the Tag (if any) for the given element and version

    • removeTagsFromElement

      public io.vertx.core.Future<Void> removeTagsFromElement(String elementID, io.vertx.core.json.JsonArray tagsToRemove)
      Remove the tags (not the versions just the tag associations) from the element.
      Parameters:
      elementID - the elementID for which to remove versions
      tagsToRemove - the tags to remove from the element.
      Returns:
      A successful Future if the tags were removed.

    • addTagToVersion

      public io.vertx.core.Future<Void> addTagToVersion(String elementID, String version, String tag)
      Add Tag to a specific version of the element
      Parameters:
      elementID - the elementID for which to remove versions
      version - the version to add the tag to.
      tag - the tags to remove from the element.
      Returns:
      A successful Future if the tags were removed.

    • getVersionListForElement

      Parameters:
      id - The id of the element in question
      Returns:
      A Future of a JsonArray containing the Versions for the element

    • getAPIElementFromDB

      Parameters:
      UUID - the UUID of the element to be returned
      version - the version of the element to be returned

    • handleGetFile

      public io.vertx.core.Future<DataLakeFile> handleGetFile(String elementID, String elementVersion, String filename)
      Get the DataLakeFile for the given FileName of the taskID Version
      Parameters:
      elementID - the Id of the element
      elementVersion - the Version of the element
      filename - the filename of the requested file
      Returns:
      a Future of the DataLakeFile associated with the given file at this version for the element.

    • handlePostFile

      public io.vertx.core.Future<String> handlePostFile(String elementID, String elementVersion, String filename, SOILEUpload upload)
      Post a given upload to the given task at the given version. Return the new version of the element with the file added.
      Parameters:
      elementID - the id of the element
      elementVersion - the version of the element to add the file to
      filename - the name of the file
      upload - the upload to associate with the file.
      Returns:
      A Future with the NEw Version of the repository for this element with the data added.

    • handlePostFiles

      public io.vertx.core.Future<String> handlePostFiles(String elementID, String elementVersion, String dirName, List<io.vertx.ext.web.FileUpload> uploads)
      Post a given upload to the given task at the given version. Return the new version of the element with the file added.
      Parameters:
      elementID - the id of the element
      elementVersion - the version of the element to add the file to
      dirName - the name of the directory all the files are to be extracted to.
      uploads - the files to be uploaded
      Returns:
      A Future with the NEw Version of the repository for this element with the data added.

    • doesRepoAtVersionExist

      public io.vertx.core.Future<Boolean> doesRepoAtVersionExist(String UUID, String version)
      Check whether the repo (element) exists and has the specified version
      Parameters:
      UUID - The UUID of the element (repo)
      version - the version to check
      Returns:
      A Future of whether the repo exists

    • handleWriteFileToObject

      public io.vertx.core.Future<String> handleWriteFileToObject(String elementID, String elementVersion, String filename, InputStream is)
      Write a given Stream to a File with a given name and return the new git version with this file written.
      Parameters:
      elementID - the id of the element
      elementVersion - the version of the element to add the file to
      filename - the name of the file
      is - the InputStream thats being written to the target file.
      Returns:
      A Future with the NEw Version of the repository for this element with the data added.

    • handleDeleteFile

      public io.vertx.core.Future<String> handleDeleteFile(String elementID, String elementVersion, String filename)
      Delete a given file from the given Version returning a new version without the element.
      Parameters:
      elementID - the id of the element
      elementVersion - the version of the element to add the file to
      filename - the name of the file
      Returns:
      A Future with the New Version of the repository for this element with the data added.
